page.title: 13TEMPLE NORMANTONS NEW CHURCH
page.content: The new church will be unique. In an attempt to minimize the effects of subsidence a concrete raft has been built resting on the top of the ground To this will be bolted the structure made of Glass Reinforced Plastic (GRP) Made in Derby, GRP is light, strong, durable, thermally efficient, easily maintained and with an in-built stone colour. The large panelled sections are fitted together to create a barrel vaulted structure 8 metres wide and 16 metres in length. Within the church will be a worship area, vestry, cloak rooms and a galley. The Altar, Font, Lectern and other smaller items from the old church will be incorporated in the new building. However, a flexible interior is planned to allow for other community uses. Erected in the church yard there will be a large fibre glass cross with metal railings at the base.
